CatDescriptText: Mr. Felix Zgorliski, factory worker, Hendersonville, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 1, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that 18-year-olds should be given the privilege of voting?" answer reads: "Yes. If they are old enough to fight in Armed Forces, they are eligible and entitled to vote.  By voting, they are defending their country, also though the fact that they are helping to put the right man into office."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Felix Zgorliski wearing plaid shirt, standing in front of store window with cigars, Downtown
